publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: ï¿½2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

div1.head: Illuminated Books
div1.bibl: Songs of Innocence and of Experience, copy Y.Accession nos. 17.01.1-54

div2.head: Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Hayley, William. Designs to A Series of Ballads. 1802. Plate 1 only.Accession no. 2007.49.378
Remember Me! 1825. Plate only.Accession no. 2007.49.412.2
Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Accession no. 21.36.76
Virgil. The Pastorals of Virgil. 1821. Two sets of Blake's wood engravings only, probably Linnell impressions.Accession nos. 31.87.13-31, 32.1.1-20

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers
div2.bibl: Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1808. Plate 5 only, 1st published state.Accession no. 66.555.54
Blair, Robert. The Grave. 1813. Quarto issue with the 3rd published states, plates only on laid India paper.Accession nos. 17.3.2391-2400, 17.3.2600, 17.3.2887

div2.head: Engraved by Blake after Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Allen, Charles. A New and Improved Roman History. 1798. Plate 2 only.Accession no. 40.52.117
Darwin, Erasmus. The Botanic Garden. 1791. Plate 1 only.Accession no. 68.540.10
Darwin, Erasmus. The Botanic Garden. 1795. Two impressions of plate 6 only.Accession nos. 66.544.31, 2007.49.389
Emlyn, Henry. A Proposition for a New Order in Architecture. 1797. Accession no. 47.115.2
Enfield, William. The Speaker, or, Miscellaneous Pieces. 1781. Plate only.Accession no. 17.3.2829
Flaxman, John. Compositions from the Works, Days, and Theogony of Hesiod. 1817. Accession no. 1977.595.53
Flaxman, John. The Iliad of Homer. 1805. Two copies.Accession nos. 1970.565.63, 1970.613.28
Fuseli, Henry. Lectures on Painting. 1801. Accession no. 1979.571.56
Hogarth, William. The Original Works. 1790. Three impressions of Blake's plate.Accession nos. 32.35(208) (1st published state), 17.3.946 (2nd published state), 91.1.125 (later state)
Shakespeare, William. The Plays. 1805. 9 vol. issue, 2 copies.Accession nos. 1971.559.10(6), 1971.559.10(9)

div1.head: Separate Prints and Prints in Series

div2.head: Plates Designed and Engraved by Blake
div2.bibl: Enoch. Accession no. 2013.146
George Cumberland's Card. 4 impressions.Accession no. 25.85.1, 3 impressions in an album of bookplates
Illustrations of the Book of Job. Accession nos. 17.17.1-1 through 1-22

div2.head: Plates Engraved by Blake after Designs by Other Artists
div2.bibl: Winged Figure Flying through Clouds. Accession no. 2007.49.379

div2.head: Color Printed Drawings
div2.bibl: God Judging Adam. Accession no. 16.38
Pity. Accession no. 58.603

div2.head: Monochrome Wash Drawings
div2.bibl: The Resurrection or The Last Trumpet (recto), studies of eyes, the head of an eagle, a human face, and a lion (verso).Accession no. 2011.448

div2.head: Water Color Drawings
div2.bibl: And the Angel which I Saw Lifted Up his Hand to Heaven. Accession no. 14.81.1
The Parable of the Wise and Foolish Virgins. Accession no. 14.81.2
The Repose of the Holy Family in Egypt. Accession no. 06.1322.1

div2.head: Paintings
div2.bibl: The Angel Gabriel Appearing to Zacharias. Accession no. 51.30.1

div1.head: Related Materials
div1.bibl: Death's Door. An uninscribed, anonymous re-engraving, probably copied from Schiavonetti's engraving in Blair's Grave with right and left reversed.Accession no. 17.3.2401
